Generation I.Red: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
Generation I.Yellow: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
Generation I.Stadium: It takes time for the shell to form and harden after hatching. It sprays foam powerfully from its mouth.

Generation II.Gold: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prodding fingers will bounce off it.
Generation II.Silver: The shell, which hardens soon after it is born, is resilient. If you poke it, it will bounce back out.
Generation II.Crystal: When it feels threatened, it draws its legs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
Generation II.Stadium 2: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prodding fingers will bounce off it. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The shell, which hardens soon after it is born, is resilient. If you poke it, it will bounce back out. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Squirtle 's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pok é mon to swim at high speeds.
Generation III.Sapphire: Squirtle 's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pok é mon to swim at high speeds.
Generation III.Emerald: Its shell is not just for protection. Its rounded shape and the grooves on its surface minimize resistance in water, enabling Squirtle to swim at high speeds.
Generation III.FireRed: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
Generation III.LeafGreen: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

Generation IV.Diamond: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
Generation IV.Pearl: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
Generation IV.Platinum: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
Generation IV.HeartGold: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prodding fingers will bounce off it.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: The shell, which hardens soon after it is born, is resilient. If you poke it, it will bounce back out.

Generation V.White 2: It shelters itself in its shell then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

Generation VI.X: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
Generation VI.Y: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Squirtle's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.

Generation VIII.Sword: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
Generation VIII.Shield: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It hides in its shell to protect itself, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It hides in its shell to protect itself, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

Generation IX.Scarlet: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It sprays a potent foam from its mouth.
Generation IX.Violet: Its shell is soft immediately after it is born. In no time at all, the shell becomes so resilient that a prodding finger will bounce right off it.

Generation I.Red: First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Blue: First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Blue (Japan): First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Yellow: Received from Officer Jenny in Vermilion City after receiving the Thunder Badge
